p: Another study evaluated the implementation of an intervention strategy to decrease the amount of A. aegypti in 2012 and 2013. Participants were divided into 10 intervention groups and 10 control groups, and activities such as workshops, cleaning campaigns, and student and older inhabitant mobilization were conducted. Differences in social participation, commitment and leadership were observed between the groups, and a higher efficacy was observed in the intervention group than in the control group. Social participation and environmental management are viable and promising alternatives to vector measures for dengue vector control 64.
